column4: I recently installed Ubuntu on my old desktop and when everything's done and installed, I see a black screen... I can type in my name and pass and hear the OS start up, but it displays nothing... Is there a cure for this?
Anyone?
I didn't know if this was a common problem

I recently installed Ubuntu on my old desktop and when everything's done and installed, I see a black screen... I can type in my name and pass and hear the OS start up, but it displays nothing... Is there a cure for this?
Any suggestions?
But I only set it to accept 1024x768 during installation, it'll still do larger?
Anyone else ever have resolution problems?
Thanks, though, stang :)

I recently installed Ubuntu on my old desktop and when everything's done and installed, I see a black screen... I can type in my name and pass and hear the OS start up, but it displays nothing... Has this happened to anyone?
can you startx
startx? If it has to do with the OS, it disappears as soon as it loads
what errors?

I install Ubuntu Warty. As soon as the installation is over and the OS starts up (where it should be the name: pass:) screen, the monitor doesn't display anything... It goes into "monitor is ok, check cables" mode
wow
As if it's trying to put up a resolution that my monitor doesn't support
But I only choose 1024, 800 and 600, and I know my monitor can take all of those
What do you mean, geneo93?
And stang, I'm not sure
sounds about right does it start to load the os?
Yeah, it loads everything, you can hear the sounds... I blindly type in my name/pass and it starts up
you running grub?
Yes, infidel
try booting into console mode
